dialogue_turns.speaker: Narrator
dialogue_turns.text: Victory Day in Moscow, with 19 world leaders expected to attend.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a huge gathering, and Kassym-Jomart Tokayev is among them.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President of Kazakhstan, Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, has arrived in Russia at the invitation of President Vladimir Putin to take part in events marking the 80th anniversary of Victory in the Great Patriotic War, citing the Akorda press service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and uh, he's also planning to meet with other foreign leaders while he's there.

dialogue_turns.text: I saw that—leaders from CIS countries, plus folks like the presidents of Venezuela and Brazil.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Russian media, the Victory Day parade in Moscow will be attended by leaders of CIS countries as well as Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic, Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico, and Milorad Dodik, President of the Republika Srpska of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
